name: Calgary
fun_fact: Fun fact: Calgary invented TWO iconic Canadian foods - the Caesar cocktail (1969, invented by Walter Chell at the Calgary Inn, now Westin Hotel) inspired by spaghetti alle vongole, and ginger beef (1975, created at Silver Inn Restaurant by George Wong who adapted a Chinese dish for Albertans who preferred tender beef over chewy). Both are now beloved across Canada but started right here in 'Cow Town'.

hero_dishes.name: Alberta Beef Steak
hero_dishes.description: Premium aged beef (minimum 28 days) known worldwide for unparalleled flavor and quality - often striploin or ribeye, brushed with butter and broiled
hero_dishes.origin_story: Alberta beef is one of the province's Seven Signature Foods. Calgary earned the nickname 'Cow Town' from its deep ranching roots. The Calgary Stampede celebrates this heritage annually, with live cattle displays and cooking competitions featuring Alberta beef striploin.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Caesar's Steakhouse (Calgary institution since 1972, 28-day aged exclusive Alberta beef); CHARCUT Roast House (award-winning, locally sourced urban-rustic); Major Tom (40th floor, aged Alberta Angus brushed with butter); Modern Steak (trendy vibe)

hero_dishes.name: Ginger Beef
hero_dishes.description: Deep-fried strips of battered Alberta beef in sticky, slightly spicy sauce, stir-fried with bell peppers and onions, served over rice
hero_dishes.origin_story: Invented in 1975 at Silver Inn Restaurant by George Wong, who had worked in Peking-style restaurants in Hong Kong. He remembered a sweet, chewy Chinese beef dish, but Calgarians preferred their Alberta beef tender, not chewy - so he adapted it. The Silver Inn ran for nearly 50 years until 2022.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Ginger Beef Bistro House (dedicated restaurant celebrating the dish); Chinese restaurants throughout Calgary (nearly every menu features it); Deane House (reimagines it as 'ginger beets' in creative nod)

hero_dishes.name: Calgary Stampede Foods
hero_dishes.description: Western-style culinary creations: bison burgers, cowboy breakfasts, and adventurous midway inventions like Cowboy Twinkies (beef brisket, cream cheese, jalapeÃ±os, bacon) and Cowboyaki (Japanese street food meets Stampede)
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Calgary Stampede (July 5-14, 2024 welcomed 1.3+ million guests) stays true to Western roots while celebrating Alberta's agricultural heritage. The Ag Grill and Kitchen Theatre feature local producers and chefs competing with Alberta beef.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Calgary Stampede Ag Grill (cowboy breakfasts, bison burgers, fresh grab 'n' go); Range Food Hall (Big Four Building, food exhibitors with live entertainment); Cattle Trail showcase in Nutrien Western Event Centre

hero_dishes.name: Modern Canadian Fusion
hero_dishes.description: Innovative dishes combining Alberta ingredients with global techniques - lentil hummus (Alberta/Saskatchewan lentils), locally sourced game, prairie vegetables
hero_dishes.origin_story: Calgary's emerging food scene balances ranching heritage with forward-thinking cuisine. Restaurants like Deane House (opened 2016 in restored 1906 residence) offer clever culinary history nods.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Deane House (historic district, ginger beets, lentil hummus); diverse restaurant scene in downtown Calgary emerging as one of Canada's best food cities

signature_drinks.name: Caesar Cocktail
signature_drinks.description: Vodka, Clamato juice, hot sauce, Worcestershire, pepper, lime and celery-salt rim - invented in Calgary 1969
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Customized endlessly with pickle juice, horseradish, elaborate garnishes. Build-your-own Caesar bars are hugely popular. The Beltliner has a Caesar bar. Calgary's cocktail culture revolves around this local invention.

signature_drinks.name: Local Craft Beer
signature_drinks.description: Alberta's thriving craft beer scene with breweries throughout Calgary
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Paired with Alberta beef at steakhouses, enjoyed at Stampede (ice-cold bottled or chopp draft), or at cocktail bars like Missy's This That with encyclopedic spirits lists
